conbody.p: Used to insert a new record or update an existing one. If the document doesnâ€™t exist it will be created. UPSERT is a combination of INSERT and UPDATE.
keyspace-ref: Specifies the keyspace into which to upsert the document.
You can add an optional namespace-name to the keyspace-name in this way:
For example, main:customer indicates the customer keyspace in the main namespace. If the namespace name is omitted, the default namespace in the current session is used.
insert-values: Specifies the values to be upserted.
insert-select: Specifies the values to be upserted as a SELECT statement.
returning-clause: Returns the data you upserted as specified in the result_expression.

User executing the UPSERT statement must have the Query Update and Query Insert privileges on the target keyspace. If the statement has any clauses that needs data read, such as WHERE clause or RETURNING clause, then Query Select privilege is also required on the keyspaces referred in the respective clauses. For more details about user roles, see .
To execute the following statement, user must have the Query Update and Query Insert privileges on `travel-sample`.
To execute the following statement, user must have the Query Update and Query Insert privileges on the `travel-sample` bucket and Query Select privilege on `travel-sample` (for RETURNING clause).

p.codeblock: UPSERT INTO `travel-sample` (KEY, VALUE) VALUES ("key1", { "type" : "hotel", "name" : "new hotel" }) RETURNING *

conbody.p: To execute the following statement, user must have the Query Update and Query Insert privileges on the `travel-sample` bucket and Query Select privilege on `beer-sample`.

p.codeblock: UPSERT INTO `travel-sample` (KEY foo, VALUE bar) SELECT foo, bar FROM `beer-sample`
